Literature Review: Mental health in the workplace has become a critical area of research and practice, particularly in light of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. The increasing societal awareness of mental health issues has prompted a surge in studies examining the occupational predictors and outcomes of mental ill health. This literature review aims to synthesize current knowledge on the definitions of employee mental health, the economic and social costs of mental illness, and the role of the workplace in promoting positive mental health, preventing mental illness, intervening to address mental health issues, and accommodating employees with mental health challenges.
